channel.title: Getting Error when I try to Run Server
channel.description:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemPrices(ItemHandler.java:321) at server.world.ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:35) at server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:67) Press any key to continue . . .
That's the error. Someone help me please.

That doesn’t say a whole hell of a lot, mind posting the actual ITEM_LIMIT code?

I’m not sure what you’re asking for exactly, can you add me on Skype and help?

item.source: Getting Error when I try to Run Server

item.title: Getting Error when I try to Run Server
item.dc:creator: @Kwappy Kwappy
item.description:
@Kwappy wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:3, topic:540468”][quote author=xX4m4zingXx link=topic=659329.msg4409461#msg4409461 date=1393074771]
and it’s something with an 1
[/quote]
lol

It means that the code at line 321 in ItemHandler.java overflows the array when trying to read/store an element. Arrays are indexed from zero, so the fact that you get an out of bounds exception when trying to read value 1 means that your array only contains a single value (or is empty!).

Anyway, post the code around that line… those of us who don’t have a copy of your source wont know how to fix the problem unless you post the code.[/quote]
public ItemHandler() {
for(int i = 0; i < Config.ITEM_LIMIT; i++) {
ItemList[i] = null;
}
loadItemList(“item.cfg”);
loadItemPrices(“prices.txt”);

Any ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Getting Error when I try to Run Server

@xx_matty_xx wrote:

xX4m4zingXx:

and it’s something with an 1

lol

It means that the code at line 321 in ItemHandler.java overflows the array when trying to read/store an element. Arrays are indexed from zero, so the fact that you get an out of bounds exception when trying to read value 1 means that your array only contains a single value (or is empty!).

Anyway, post the code around that line… those of us who don’t have a copy of your source wont know how to fix the problem unless you post the code.
